description_txt: stated on January 24, 2008 in a chain e-mail based on an article written by Dick Morris:
quote_txt: "She flunked the D.C. bar exam."

description_txt: stated on February 5, 2008 in a statement read on the Laura Ingraham Show :
quote_txt: John McCain "said publicly that Hillary Clinton would make a good president."

description_txt: stated on February 11, 2008 in an RNC Web site feature where you can send a GOP valentine from your favorite Democrat:
quote_txt: RNC version of a Hillary Clinton valentine: "Roses are red, violets are blue, I'll raise your taxes and there is nothing you can do."

description_txt: stated on January 21, 2008 in Myrtle Beach, S.C.:
quote_txt: "On issue after issue that really were hard to explain or understand, you voted present . . . And anytime anyone raises that, there's always some kind of explanation."

description_txt: stated on February 13, 2008 in in a television ad:
quote_txt: Hillary Clinton "has the only health care plan that covers every American."

description_txt: stated on February 11, 2008 in an ABC/Politico interview:
quote_txt: "I have something in common with my husband. He never carried caucuses either. He lost all of the ones that I've lost."

description_txt: stated on February 11, 2008 in a conference call to reporters led by Cilnton pollster Mark Penn:
quote_txt: "Senator Obama has, in fact, never had a serious Republican challenger."

description_txt: stated on February 7, 2008 in Portland, Maine:
quote_txt: "Everything I have said (on the campaign trail) has been factually accurate."

description_txt: stated on February 10, 2008 in Camp David:
quote_txt: Barack Obama said "he's going to attack Pakistan and embrace (Iranian President Mahmoud) Ahmadinejad."

description_txt: stated on February 1, 2008 in a flyer sent prior to Super Tuesday:
quote_txt: "8 years of the Clintons, major losses for Democrats across the nation."

description_txt: stated on February 10, 2008 in a campaign rally in Alexandria, Va.:
quote_txt: Hillary Clinton "starts off with 47 percent of the country against her."

description_txt: stated on February 10, 2008 in a campaign rally in Alexandra, Va.:
quote_txt: "She said, you know, 'I voted for it, but I hoped it wouldn't pass.' That was a quote on live TV."

description_txt: stated on February 10, 2008 in a campaign rally in Alexandria, Va.:
quote_txt: Americans "have never paid more for gas at the pump."

description_txt: stated on February 10, 2008 in a campaign rally in Alexandria, Va.:
quote_txt: "The last six polls, including this week's Time magazine, show that I beat John McCain by six or seven points."

description_txt: stated on January 6, 2008 in a chain e-mail sent to many people.:
quote_txt: "While others place their hands over their hearts, Obama turns his back to the flag and slouches."

description_txt: stated on February 6, 2008 in an interview on MSNBC:
quote_txt: "I'm the only Republican who has gotten endorsements in this presidential race from major labor unions..."

description_txt: stated on January 18, 2008 in an interview on MSNBC's Morning Joe.:
quote_txt: "When I was in college, we used to take a popcorn popper . . . and we would fry squirrel."

description_txt: stated on February 6, 2008 in a TV ad airing in Virginia, the District of Columbia and Maryland:
quote_txt: "One man sacrificed for his country. One man opposed a flawed strategy in Iraq. One man had the courage to call for change. One man didn't play politics with the truth. One man stands up to the special interests."

description_txt: stated on February 4, 2008 in an e-mail message sent to voters before Super Tuesday.:
quote_txt: "Sen. Obama has always had a 100 percent prochoice rating."

description_txt: stated on December 20, 2007 in Iowa:
quote_txt: In the Illinois Legislature, Barack Obama "voted 'present,' instead of yes or no" on seven votes involving abortion rights.

description_txt: stated on February 3, 2008 in an interview on "Face the Nation":
quote_txt: In the Florida Republican primary, "we got a very large percentage of the, quote, conservative vote."

description_txt: stated on January 31, 2008 in a debate in Los Angeles:
quote_txt: "George Bush sent people to war without body armor."

description_txt: stated on February 1, 2008 in in a TV ad:
quote_txt: John McCain "voted against the Bush tax cuts, both times."

description_txt: stated on February 3, 2008 in a campaign event in Fairfield, Conn.:
quote_txt: "In her short time in the United States Senate, the senator from New York, Senator Clinton, got $500-million worth of pork barrel projects."

description_txt: stated on February 1, 2008 in Denver:
quote_txt: John McCain has said the economy is "not his strong suit."

description_txt: stated on February 1, 2008 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "(John McCain) was even mentioned as a running mate with John Kerry."

description_txt: stated on January 30, 2008 in Denver:
quote_txt: Hillary Clinton "agrees with (John McCain) in embracing the Bush-Cheney policy of not talking to leaders we don't like."

description_txt: stated on January 30, 2008 in Denver:
quote_txt: Hillary Clinton "actually differed with (John McCain) by arguing for exceptions for torture before changing positions."

description_txt: stated on January 30, 2008 in Denver:
quote_txt: Hillary Clinton "agreed with (John McCain) on voting for the war in Iraq."

description_txt: stated on January 30, 2008 in a debate in Simi Valley, Calif.:
quote_txt: "(Romney's) record was that he raised taxes by $730-million."
